alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 20 at 12:45AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...For the Yukon River, from the mouth of the Nowitna River to Nulato, including Galena and Koyukuk * WHEN...Through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas along the Yukon River is now occurring near the Nowitna River area. Water could rise very rapidly as a surge of water and ice moves downstream. Fish camps and cabins along the Yukon River from the mouth of the Nowitna River to Nulato could become impacted by high water levels. Ruby is not expected to flood due to their elevation above the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The ice jam 20 miles upriver from Ruby on the Yukon River released at 7pm on Friday evening. A surge of water and ice is now moving down the Yukon River. High water is expected to reach Galena Saturday morning, during the day at Koyukuk and by Saturday night at Nulato. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River between the Nowitna and Koyukuk Rivers stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Those living in areas prone to flooding should prepare now for possible ice jam flooding. Move valuables to higher ground and prepare to evacuate on short notice. If flooding develops, water will rise very fast.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
